The museum collects, houses, and preserves a collection of art which include Impressionists, Post-Impressionists and twentieth-century art by Japanese, European and American artists. Ceramic works from Ancient Greece are also featured.Dunn, Michael. "Bridgestone Museum Celebrates 50th Anniversary," The Japan Times, May 4, 2006. Retrieved 2012-2-8. The Bridgestone Museum is in Kyōbashi, Chūō Ward. It is on the second floor of the headquarters of the Bridgestone Corporation.Bridgestone Museum of Art, History ; retrieved 2012-2-8. ==History== The museum was established in 1952 by Ishibashi Shojiro. He was the founder of Bridgestone Tire Company. His personal collection of art formed the core of the museum's holdings. In 50 years, the collection has expanded.Bridgestone Museum of Art, Mission ; retrieved 2012-2-8. In 1980, the Museum gained international attention when it purchased Pablo Picasso's Saltimbanque Seated with Arms Crossed.Reif, Rita. "A Picasso Goes For $3 Million At Record Sale," The New York Times. May 13, 1980. Retrieved 2012-2-8. In 1987, the Museum bought Pierre-Auguste Renoir's Mlle Georgette Charpentier Seated.Chira, Susan. "Art Inc.," The New York Times. May 3, 1987.
